verses.verse: Satanic Rebellion Crushed Now when the thousand years have expired, Satan will be released from his prison

and will go out (Rev. 12:9; 20:3, 10) to deceive the nations which are in the four corners of the earth, (Ezek. 38:2; 39:1, 6) Gog and Magog, (Rev. 16:14) to gather them together to battle, whose number is as the sand of the sea.
(Is. 8:8; Ezek. 38:9, 16) They went up on the breadth of the earth and surrounded the camp of the saints and the beloved city. And fire came down from God out of heaven and devoured them.

The devil, who deceived them, was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone (Rev. 19:20; 20:14, 15) where the beast and the false prophet are. And they (Rev. 14:10) will be tormented day and night forever and ever.

The Great White Throne Judgment Then I saw a great white throne and Him who sat on it, from whose face (2 Pet. 3:7; Rev. 21:1) the earth and the heaven fled away. (Dan. 2:35; Rev. 12:8) And there was found no place for them.

And I saw the dead, (Rev. 19:5) small and great, standing before God, (Dan. 7:10) and books were opened. And another (Ps. 69:28; Dan. 12:1; Phil. 4:3; Rev. 3:5) book was opened, which is the Book of Life. And the dead were judged (Jer. 17:10; Matt. 16:27; Rom. 2:6; Rev. 2:23; 20:12) according to their works, by the things which were written in the books.

The sea gave up the dead who were in it, (1 Cor. 15:26; Rev. 1:18; 6:8; 21:4) and Death and Hades delivered up the dead who were in them. (Matt. 16:27; Rev. 2:23; 20:12) And they were judged, each one according to his works.
Then (1 Cor. 15:26; Rev. 1:18; 6:8; 21:4) Death and Hades were cast into the lake of fire. (Rev. 21:8) This is the second death.
And anyone not found written in the Book of Life (Rev. 19:20) was cast into the lake of fire.

All Things Made New Now (Is. 65:17; 66:22; (2 Pet. 3:13)) I saw a new heaven and a new earth, ((2 Pet. 3:10); Rev. 20:11) for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away. Also there was no more sea.
Then I, John, saw (Is. 52:1; (Gal. 4:26); Heb. 11:10) the holy city, New Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared (Is. 54:5; 2 Cor. 11:2) as a bride adorned for her husband.

And I heard a loud voice from heaven saying, “Behold, (Lev. 26:11; Ezek. 43:7; 2 Cor. 6:16) the tabernacle of God is with men, and He will dwell with them, and they shall be His people. God Himself will be with them and be their God.

(Is. 25:8; Rev. 7:17) And God will wipe away every tear from their eyes; (1 Cor. 15:26; Rev. 20:14) there shall be no more death, (Is. 35:10; 51:11; 65:19) nor sorrow, nor crying. There shall be no more pain, for the former things have passed away.”
Then (Rev. 4:2, 9; 20:11) He who sat on the throne said, (Is. 43:19; 2 Cor. 5:17) “Behold, I make all things new.” And He said to me, “Write, for (Rev. 19:9; 22:6) these words are true and faithful.”

And He said to me, (Rev. 10:6; 16:17) “It is done! (Rev. 1:8; 22:13) I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End. (Is. 12:3; 55:1; John 4:10; Rev. 7:17; 22:17) I will give of the fountain of the water of life freely to him who thirsts.
He who overcomes shall inherit all things, and (Zech. 8:8; Heb. 8:10) I will be his God and he shall be My son.

(1 Cor. 6:9; Gal. 5:19; Eph. 5:5; 1 Tim. 1:9; (Heb. 12:14)) But the cowardly, unbelieving, abominable, murderers, sexually immoral, sorcerers, idolaters, and all liars shall have their part in (Rev. 20:14) the lake which burns with fire and brimstone, which is the second death.”

The New Jerusalem Then one of (Rev. 15:1) the seven angels who had the seven bowls filled with the seven last plagues came to me and talked with me, saying, “Come, I will show you (Rev. 19:7; 21:2) the bride, the Lamb’s wife.”
And he carried me away (Rev. 1:10) in the Spirit to a great and high mountain, and showed me (Ezek. 48) the great city, the holy Jerusalem, descending out of heaven from God,
(Is. 60:1; Ezek. 43:2; Rev. 15:8; 21:23; 22:5) having the glory of God. Her light was like a most precious stone, like a jasper stone, clear as crystal.
Also she had a great and high wall with (Ezek. 48:31-34) twelve gates, and twelve angels at the gates, and names written on them, which are the names of the twelve tribes of the children of Israel:
(Ezek. 48:31-34) three gates on the east, three gates on the north, three gates on the south, and three gates on the west.
Now the wall of the city had twelve foundations, and (Matt. 16:18; Luke 22:29, 30; Gal. 2:9; Eph. 2:20) on them were the names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb.
And he who talked with me (Ezek. 40:3; Zech. 2:1; Rev. 11:1) had a gold reed to measure the city, its gates, and its wall.
The city is laid out as a square; its length is as great as its breadth. And he measured the city with the reed: twelve thousand furlongs. Its length, breadth, and height are equal.
Then he measured its wall: one hundred and forty-four cubits, according to the measure of a man, that is, of an angel.
The construction of its wall was of jasper; and the city was pure gold, like clear glass.
